translations: 使受精，使受粉，使受孕；施肥于，使（土壤）肥沃（fertilise 的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.sentence: Both females will have laid a fertilised egg and randomly shunted one aside (Biology Letters, vol 4, p 323).
sentences.translation: 这两只雌鸟会各自产下一枚受过精的卵，并且随机扔掉一枚（《生物通讯》，第4卷，第323页）。

sentences.sentence: In one word, the right electives can help me to do better on the own subject learning and fertilised myself.
sentences.translation: 总而言之，选择合适的选修课是为了更好的学习专业知识，丰富内心。

sentences.sentence: Yet, organic crops fertilised with animal manure have no such requirements—even though they pose a far higher risk to human health.
sentences.translation: 然而，用动物粪便生产的有机农作物却没有这样的要求——即使这些食品对人类健康构成更大的风险。
